---
title: "Does flipper length predict body mass in Adelie penguins?"
author: "Irena Papst"
format: revealjs
editor: visual
---

```{r}
#| label: setup
#| echo: false
#| message: false
library(palmerpenguins)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

## Analysis code

```{r}
#| label: fun_get_model_coef
get_model_coef = function(species_name){
  obs = (penguins 
    |> dplyr::filter(species == species_name)
  )
    
  model_coef = (
    lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data = obs)
    |> coefficients()
  )
  
  return(list(
    obs = obs, 
    model_coef = model_coef
  ))
}
```

---

```{r}
#| label: plot
#| echo: false
#| fig-width: 9.5
#| fig-height: 7
#| fig-align: center
(ggplot(data)
  + geom_point(
    aes(x = flipper_length_mm,
        y = body_mass_g),
    shape = 1, size = 4, stroke = 1.5, alpha = 0.5
    )
  + geom_abline(intercept = model_coef[1], slope = model_coef[2],
                linewidth = 2, colour = "dodgerblue", alpha = 0.7)
  + labs(
    x = "Flipper length (mm)",
    y = "Body mass (g)",
    title = "Relationship between flipper length and body mass for Adelie penguins",
    subtitle = "Observations (points) vs linear model fit (line)"
  )
  + theme_bw(
    base_size = 16
  )
)
```
